alert.note: Alert for Yoakum (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 7:25PM CDT until May 10 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following county, Yoakum. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding on roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 723 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong to severe thunderstorms producing very heavy rain spreading east out of New Mexico into western parts of the county. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - US 62 southwest of Plains will likely see some of the heaviest rain. Additional rainfall amounts of one to two inches will be possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Denver City, Plains and Bronco. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
